com.mydomain
Class Grid

java.lang.Object
  com.mydomain.Grid

public class Grid
extends java.lang.Object

IEOR 140 Team 6 Date: October 11, 2012 Class Name: Grid Authors: Moonsoo Choi and Sherman Siu Program description: The Grid class is responsible for calculating the distances of each node on the coordinate grid from your desired destination. Throughout the grid navigation, the Grid class will maintain an internal “map” of the node distances and will keep track of which nodes are blocked (as determined by the robot as it navigates). The robot will navigate based off of the smallest distance value determined by Grid.java for each neighboring node.

Constructor Detail

Grid

public Grid(int _gridX,

Sets constructor Grid, taking in values _gridX and _gridY. Then creates a node for every coordinate in the determined Grid.

Parameters:

_gridY -
Method Detail

recalc

public void recalc()
recalc() calculates the distance value for each node in the grid. It first resets all the nodes, then it sets the distance of the destination to zero. From there, for each valid neighboring node the distance increases by one from the distance node, then subsequently increasing by one from that neighboring node, and so forth.

setDestination

public void setDestination(int _X,
                           int _Y)
Set the destination node in the grid.

Parameters:
_X -
_Y -

neighbor

public Node neighbor(Node _nodes,
                     int direction)
The constructor retrieves the neighboring nodes from the current node. Based on the direction, the constructor will return a node either to the left, right, front, or back, of the robot. It will return a null if the node is either non-existent or is blocked.

Parameters:
_nodes -
direction -
Returns:
